description:
JobPrep is a series of modules aim at people who want to get prepared to find their next job or are looking to maximize their salary and advancement prospects in their existing role.

I have been a professional salesperson, Executive Recruiter and Entrepreneur for over 15 years. As a Recruiter I have interviewed over 8,000 candidates and I have read over a quarter of a million resumes - so I have an in-depth understand of the good, the bad and the downright ugly as far as recruitment and resumes are concerned.

The first module - The Resume - will show you the best resume structure and content to use to make sure that it gets read and gives you the best possible chance of getting an interview.

We are going to go through what the job market is like, why are you looking for another role in the first place, and what alternatives have you got apart from leaving the job you are in.

Next I'm going to share with you what employers are really looking for in a candidate. You might be surprised just how many of the criteria you do (or do not) meet!

Then we get into the guts of it - what does the best resume look like, how is it structured, why do some get read and others just get checked in the bin?

I'm also going to give you a fairly long list of the "Do's and Don'ts" when preparing your resume. The devil is in the detail and sometimes it's the little things that make all the difference.

The Lost Art of the Cover Letter OR how to rocket yourself right to the front of the queue! Why you should take the time to use this as your IMPACT STATEMENT!

I'm also going to share with you some simple ideas on where else you can look for a job rather than continuously smashing yourself on the job boards. There may be some absolute gems right in front of your nose that you never considered.

Yes, you'll get a first class resume from doing this course but the real benefit will come from knowing how to use it, where to use it, and who to use it on!

So, let's prepare for your next job.
title: Prepare for your next job - How to write a cracking resume!
